colors.name: Red Roof Tile by Machine Special
Red Roof Tile ADOBE by Machine Special
Atlas
colors.manufacturer_description: Atlas is a highly saturated striking color, four times as strong as Skiron. Pure silver is the only colorant. Atlas can produce a range of colors both transparent and opaque, including ambers, purples, blues and greens. It works well in both surface and encased applications. Super-heating can cause phase separation, creating patterns in the final outcome. Formulated with the same nucleation system as Skylla, Skiron, Terra3, and Ekho2. Atlas is easy to strike using the reset/cool/warm sequence. It is very responsive to varied thermal history, allowing the development of many different colors on the same piece. DH's benchmark times for surface application are Reset/30 seconds, cool/30 seconds, strike. A clear encasement layer adds about 15 seconds to the cooling and striking times. Specific times and color outcomes will vary depending on several factors. This color is COE 104 so it's compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Ekho 2
colors.manufacturer_description: Ekho reduces and strikes! It retains a pearlescent luster under encasement and strikes during the beadmaking process. For best results; work hot, cool, reduce and encase. COE 104 and compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Elpis 2
colors.manufacturer_description: Elpis is a chrome-free green reducing glass that is resistant to over reducing. She transmits a spring green color. Reformulated in 2023 COE 104 so it's compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Flora
colors.manufacturer_description: COE 104, the rods are 5-6mm in diameter and approx. 12" in length. Flora, formerly known as 2022 Test Batch HXO-866 is our Eros gold-pink in a translucent Opal base. Opacifies and strikes in the flame and kiln yielding pink and purple tones.

colors.name: Helios
colors.manufacturer_description: COE of 104, the rods are 5-6mm in diameter and approx. 12" in length. Helios is a super luster in a golden yellow citrine jewel tone. No Distributors NOTE: Double Helix Glass formulas are resistant to degradation from both acidic and basic chemicals, including atmospheric moisture and contaminants, body oils and acids, and therefore do not respond to EtchAll solutions. Olympia Rain, Kronos2, Gaia, and Nyx are susceptible to chemical solutions , as they are made from Italian Cullet. - Jed at DHG

colors.name: Hyperborea
colors.manufacturer_description: Hyperborea has a rich violet and red color transmission and easily develops a strong silver luster when reduced. It works well both in surface applications and under encasement. The color is saturated and may present best over a core of clear glass, as pictured. A replacement to Boreas, Hyperborea is made in our updated color base resulting in cleaner colors, smoother working characteristics and improved viscosity curves

colors.name: Iris
colors.manufacturer_description: COE 104. The rods are 5-6mm in diameter and approx. 12" in length Here is what DH has to say about this product: "Iris is the production version of our most popular test batch from summer 2014, AX-605. The A was for Arke and the X was for 10 times the strength! This color can yield a multicolored metallic iridescent luster. In our experience, a brush reduction flame produces the best results. Though designed specifically for exterior applications, the silver portion of the luster will hold up under encasement". No Distributors NOTE: Double Helix Glass formulas are resistant to degradation from both acidic and basic chemicals, including atmospheric moisture and contaminants, body oils and acids, and therefore do not respond to EtchAll solutions. Olympia Rain, Kronos2, Gaia, and Nyx are susceptible to chemical solutions , as they are made from Italian Cullet. - Jed at DHG

colors.name: Jinx
colors.manufacturer_description: This opal produces a range of misty opal blue and blue-green tones. The luster is best left exposed, and can be silver, gold, or iridescent depending on flame characteristics. Same as test batch ELX-891 For Best Results: Higher temperatures and longer annealing times can initiate further opacification of the opal. Encasing the Opal will also add heat and time so adjust your annealing accordingly or plan on having more opacity. We recommend using moderately thin layers of the color and annealing to 925°f. This color is COE 104 so it's compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Lotis
colors.manufacturer_description: Lotis is a pink version of Rhea. a lead free gold pink that plays well with silver color and survives a reduction flame without discolorations. From test batch RO-682 This color is COE 104 so it's compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Melia 2
colors.manufacturer_description: This color is COE 104 so it's compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Okeanos
colors.manufacturer_description: COE 104 and compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Oracle Opal Glass
colors.manufacturer_description: Oracle Opal is a striking glass that produces a range of misty opal tones. It easily resets to crystal clear, initiating the striking process. After resetting, Oracle-Opal will cool to a faint translucent opalescence. Further exposure to flame temperatures around 1000°F will cause more extensive opacification. For Best Results: If you’d like to retain the color effect as-is when you’re done, anneal cool at about 920°F for up to two hours. Higher temperatures and longer annealing times will initiate further striking of the opal. Encasing the Opal will also add heat and time so adjust your annealing accordingly or plan on having more opacity. The Bead: is a wigwag bead with Oracle Opal and Zephyr. The Oracle Project – responsibly manufactured, low toxicity glasses made in the USA, without Antimony, Arsenic, Cadmium, Chromium, Lead, Nickel, or Selenium. Balancing viscosity curves, opacity, tonality, surface tension, and thermal shock resistance, to create glass that is a pleasure to work with in the flame. NOTE: Double Helix Glass formulas are resistant to degradation from both acidic and basic chemicals, including atmospheric moisture and contaminants, body oils and acids, and therefore do not respond to EtchAll solutions. Olympia Rain, Kronos2, Gaia, and Nyx are susceptible to chemical solutions , as they are made from Italian Cullet. - Jed at DHG NO DISTRIBUTORS

colors.name: Oracle Pink Pastel
colors.manufacturer_description: Oracle Double Pink Pastel is double the pink of Oracle Pink Pastel and slower to opacify. It is a nearly opaque glass that requires no special treatment to develop its smooth and consistent soft pink tone. Single Bead; core of Oracle Double Pink Pastel encased in Zephyr with ODPP scrollwork. Double Beads; left: Oracle Pink Pastel, right: Oracle Double Pink Pastel This color is COE 104 so it's compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Theia
colors.manufacturer_description: Theia, gold-violet. A transparent gold based color that produces blues and violets. Based off of test batch RX-769. Avoid overheating to maintain color.

colors.name: Zephyr
colors.manufacturer_description: COE 104 and compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Triton
colors.manufacturer_description: Triton Double Helix Glass Rod Triton is an extra strength silver luster color on a cobalt blue base. The result of test batches K-65, K-102, and K-108 It can produce a satin iridescence, swirls of multi-colored silver and retain its luster under clear. Work in a neutral flame, allow to cool for a few seconds, reheat far out in a large reducing flame. For the multi-colored satin effect work in the tip of a larger reduction flame, let cool and then briefly reduce again. COE 104 and compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Terra 3
colors.manufacturer_description: Terra 3 Double Helix Glass Rod Terra 3 is a dual color; capable of reducing or striking. This reformulated version uses our newest nucleation system, the same as Skylla, Skiron, and Ekho2. The new nucleation system results in glass that is easier to strike. Terra 3 can be used as a surface luster, struck on the surface, or struck under a thin encasement layer. The cooling and warming portions of the striking sequence for this glass are both approximately 45 seconds. Specific times may vary depending on several factors. For best results in a striking application, apply a thin layer of clear glass to encase, then reset the Terra 3, cool, and strike the color through the clear. COE 104 and compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Psyche
colors.manufacturer_description: Psyche Double Helix Glass Rod Psyche is strong silver reduction glass in a dark purple base. Depending on the reduction process, Psyche can produce a mirrored or rainbow oil slick appearance. If encased, the luster results in a pearlescent effect. Work in a neutral flame. Cool until the glass is no longer glowing. Expose the glass to a reduction flame, while keeping it from getting hot. Brief (5-10 seconds) and repeated exposures produces the best results. COE 104 and compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Clio
colors.manufacturer_description: Clio Double Helix Glass Rod 2023 Clio production contains a purer colorant than previous production runs. Clio is a color-shifting, reset-reduce glass, that transmits ambers and reds with the reds being more visible under incandescent and sunlight. It develops a strong silver luster and maintains its pearlescence under encasement. Reset-Reduce colors need to be reset in a neutral flame before following the reducing process. See our guide on how to reset. See our Phaeton Tutorial for the best techniques to use with Clio. No Distributors NOTE: Double Helix Glass formulas are resistant to degradation from both acidic and basic chemicals, including atmospheric moisture and contaminants, body oils and acids, and therefore do not respond to EtchAll solutions. Olympia Rain, Kronos2, Gaia, and Nyx are susceptible to chemical solutions , as they are made from Italian Cullet. - Jed at DHG

colors.name: Arke
colors.manufacturer_description: Arke Double Helix Glass Rod Arke is the production version of our most popular test batch from the 2013 ISGB Gathering, IL-581. It can develop exterior metallic finishes of silver, gold, green, red and blue. Variations in flame chemistry, exposure time and temperature alter which metals are deposited on the surface of the glass. The green metallic finish in the stock photo was achieved using a “hot” reduction flame. The silver tone resulted from brief exposure to a “cool” reduction flame, while the red tones were developed by repeated reduction. Contrast between these metallic finishes can be highlighted by using a small oxidizing flame to remove the metallic luster from selected portions of the bead, then re-exposing the bead to a reduction flame, building metallic layers of alternating composition. No Distributors NOTE: Double Helix Glass formulas are resistant to degradation from both acidic and basic chemicals, including atmospheric moisture and contaminants, body oils and acids, and therefore do not respond to EtchAll solutions.

colors.name: Arke 2
colors.manufacturer_description: Arke 2 Double Helix Glass Rod Arke 2 is our updated formula that increased the silver and improved rod quality. Arke 2 is a transparent cobalt luster color that develops a variety of exterior metallic finishes and holds it’s luster under a clear encasement. It’s the lightest of our three cobalt silver glasses; Arke 2, Triton and Iris. Variations in flame chemistry, exposure time and temperature alter the color of the exterior luster. No Distributors NOTE: Double Helix Glass formulas are resistant to degradation from both acidic and basic chemicals, including atmospheric moisture and contaminants, body oils and acids, and therefore do not respond to EtchAll solutions.

colors.name: Hyperion
colors.manufacturer_description: Hyperion Double Helix Glass Rod Hyperion is a relative of Clio and our CX test series. A strong reduction color that is designed to strike automatically during the bead making process to medium amber. Encasing the light reduction in clear results in a purple pearlescent luster. For best results, follow the reset and cooling process for Striking Colors, then reduce. No Distributors NOTE: Double Helix Glass formulas are resistant to degradation from both acidic and basic chemicals, including atmospheric moisture and contaminants, body oils and acids, and therefore do not respond to EtchAll solutions. Olympia Rain, Kronos2, Gaia, and Nyx are susceptible to chemical solutions , as they are made from Italian Cullet. - Jed at DHG

colors.name: Extra Black
colors.manufacturer_description: Extra Black Double Helix Glass Rod Oracle ExtraBlack has smooth working characteristics, reads dark even when pulled thin, and does not spread excessively. Oracle ExtraBlack is made in USA without Antimony, Arsenic, Cadmium, Chromium, Lead, Nickel, or Selenium. The goal of the Oracle project create is to create American made, low-toxicity, essential glass colors for the flame. We will be producing colors free from antimony, arsenic, cadmium, chromium, lead and selenium. Oracle Black, Oracle White2, Rhea, Eros, Zephyr and Oracle ExtraBlack give 104 flame workers the option to use responsibly manufactured, low toxicity glasses in their work. This color is COE 104 so it's compatible with our other COE 104 glass!

colors.name: Oracle Opal Violet Glass
colors.manufacturer_description: Oracle Opal Violet Double Helix Glass Rod Oracle-Violet Opal , a violet slow opal, same as test batch 803.AuOpl. This opal is a striking glass that produces a range of misty opal violet tones. It easily resets to transparent pale violet, step one of the striking process. After resetting, allow it to cool to a faint opalescence. O-V-O is slower than our regular Oracle-Opal, and may require a cooler flame to strike. Longer annealing times or higher annealing temperatures can develop more opacity. We anneal at 920°F for two hours or more. The Bead: is a wigwag bead with Oracle-Violet Opal + Zephyr cane and Zephyr encasement dots.

colors.name: Knight
colors.manufacturer_description: Meet Knight, a borosilicate glass rod as dark and enigmatic as the legendary quests of King Arthur and his brave band of knights. Crafted from sleek black borosilicate glass, Knight boasts a robust and resilient form, reminiscent of the fearless gallantry of Monty Python‚Äôs finest. With a polished surface that shimmers like a the helmet of the Knights who say "Ni!", this rod stands as a testament to both strength and style. Knight will encase and implode without losing it's saturation. While it is technically transparent, Knight is so dark that it is almost impossible to see through unless extremely blown out. Knight will take all the heat you can throw at it without boiling. An oxidizing flame is preferred to reduce the risk of graying. Extremely stable and less stiff than other black rods, this is a must have for anyone's color pallet.
